oai_dc:dc.dc:title: Photograph of F.W. Greenhalge Apothecary, 1872
oai_dc:dc.dc:description: A photograph of the F.W. Greenhalge Apothecary at 7 Lafayette Street in Nashville, Tennessee. Taken in 1872, this photograph shows men and some children standing outside the storefront of the retail druggist shop. Six women look out to the street from second story apartment windows. In 1874 the store moved to the Public Square, and moved again to College Street in 1875. Boxes of powder shot, garden seeds and coal oil are lined up on the sidewalk. Greenhalge was in business from 1860 until 1900. The photograph was made by Giers & Co., a popular Nashville studio located on Union Street. Forms part of the Nashville Room Historic Photographs Collection. 1 photograph : b & w ; 8 x 10 in.
oai_dc:dc.dc:subject: Greenhalge, Foster W.
